message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.CL, cs.SI

The paper deals with the problem of multi-task learning, which is a common topic in machine learning and falls under the category of "Learning" (cs.LG). The paper also discusses the discovery of latent task structure, which involves discovering groups of related tasks, and this could be seen as a problem in unsupervised learning or clustering, which falls under the categories of "Artificial Intelligence" (cs.AI) and "Computer Vision" (cs.CV). The paper also mentions the use of a graph-based regularizer, which is a common technique in natural language processing (NLP) and could place the paper under the category of "Computation and Language" (cs.CL). Finally, the paper proposes an efficient algorithm for solving the problem, which could be seen as a contribution to optimization or algorithms research, and thus could fall under the category of "Social and Information Networks" (cs.SI).
